newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Denmark to block EU anti-Helms-Burton legislation.
newsitem.headline: Denmark to block EU anti-Helms-Burton legislation.

text.p: Denmark will block proposed European Union action to counter Washington's controversial anti-Cuba trade laws when EU foreign minister meet in Luxembourg next week, diplomatic sources said on Tuesday.
"Proposals for EU blocking tactics will not go through (on Monday) because Denmark will veto them," one source told Reuters. "The law against Helms-Burton will not go through."

Sources said Denmark was opposed to the blocking tactics because it brought into question aspects of national sovereignty. The Danish government is currently embroiled in a court case brought by a citizens group which accuses it of handing too much sovereignty to the EU.
EU foreign ministers were due next Monday to discuss laws to block the Helms-Burton Act, an amalgamation of decades of anti-Cuba policy.

Among other things the act allows American citizens to sue in U.S. courts European companies or individuals accused of profiting from investments made in property confiscated in Cuba since the Communist revolution of 1959.

The European Commission, which has already launched a complaint against the Act at the World Trade Organisation, on Monday hoped to win acceptance for another retaliatory measure which would allow European companies or individuals to counter-sue in EU member state courts.
